ï»¿OPICIAL Administration Agreement for the Swedish Trust Fund for the Moldova Agriculture Competitiveness Project (Trist Fund No. 071986/Sida Contribution No.55030024) Article 1 Subject and Amount of the Grant Section 1.01. In pursuance of the Single Donor Trust Funds Framework Agreement between Sweden, represented by the Sweiish International Development Cooperation Agency, Sida ("Sweden") and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development ("IBRD") and the Irternational Development Association (the "IDA") (collectively the "Bank") dated March 17, 2011 (the "Framework Agreement"), I am pleased to inform you that Sweden will make available a grant (the "Grent") of Swedish Kronor twenty million (SEK 20,000,000) (the "Contribution"), to be administered by the Bank for the Moldova Agriculture Competitiveness Project (Trust FLnd No. TFO71986). Section 1.02. The terms of the Framework Agreement shall apply to the Grant. The Bank shall administer the Grant in acc rdance with the provisions of the Framework Agreement, except as otherwise provided herein. Section 1.03. The Grant shall bc used exclusively for the activities described in the Annex hereto, which forms an integral part of this Administrative Agreement (the "Agreement"). Similar activities are described it. the Bank's Project Appraisal Document (No. 66484-MD) for the Moldova Agriculture Corm petitiveness Project. The Grant shall be used to finance the expenditures described in the Antiex. Notwithstanding the foregoing, and so long as there is no change in the overall objective3 or characteristics of the Grant, the Bank may reallocate the Gran1 funds between such categories of expenditures in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and proceduies on reallocation, without the need to obtain Sweden's apprcval for any such reallocation. Section 1.04. In addition to the financial reports on the Grant to be made available pursuant to Section 10.01 of the Framewcrk Agreement, the Bank shall provide an annual narrative progress report on the activities financed by the Grant and a final narrative progress report on the ac:ivities following the Completion Date. Article 2 Payment Modalities Section 2.01. Sweden shall deposit the Grant funds with the Bank, upon request from the Bank, into such bank account designated by the Bank in accordance with the provisions of Section 6.02 of the Framework A Dreement. The first installment of the Grant will be Swedish Kroncr six million (SEK 6,000.000,,. Subsequent installments of Swedish Kronor eight million (SEK 8,000,000) and Swedish Kronor six million (SEK 6,000,000) will be made in accordance with the provisions of Section 6.02(b) of the Framework Agreement. 1 I-1
ï»¿Article 3 Ad ministrative Cost Recovery Section 3.01. Consistent with Section 8.02 of the Framework Agreement, in order to assist in the d:frayment of the costs asso,iated with the establishment of this Agreement, the Bank may, :ollowing deposit of the Grant by Sweden, deduct from the Grant and retain for the Bank's own account an amount ec ual to thirty-five thousand United States Dollars ($35,000). Section 3.02. In order to assist in th. defrayment of the costs of administration and other expenses incurred by the Bank under this Agreement, the Bank may, following deposit of the Grani )y Sweden, deduct from 1he total Grant and retain for the Bank's own account an amoun equal to five percent (5/)) of the Grant, as stated in Article VIII in the Framework Agreement. If the contributions ncrease beyond what was originally expected at the time of counter-signature of this Agreerr ent, and the administrative costs increase as a result, the Donor acknowledges that an additional administrative fee may be applied to such new contrlbutions through an amendment to this Agreement. Article 4 Commencement and Completion Dates Section 4.01 The Grant funds may be used to finance expenditures for the Project commencing on the countersignature date of this Agreement and ending on December 31, 2015. The Bank may make disbursements of the Grant funds for up to six (6) months after such latter date for expenditures incurred on or before such date, in accordance with the Bank s applicable policies and prccedures. Article 5 Cancellation Section 5.01. Either party may, upon giving the other party three (3) months' prior written notice, cancel that part, if any, of the Grant funds provided under this Administration Agreenent that the Bank has not committed prior to receipt of such notice under agreements entered into by the Bank with any third party, including any grant agreement. Article 6 Communications Section 6.01. The offices resp )nsible for coordination of all matters related to this Administration Agreement are: For Swveden: For the Bank: Andrei Darie Anatol Gobjila National Program Officer Senior Operations Officer Embassy of the Kingdom of Sweden World Bank Office 12, T Ciorba Str. 20/1, Puskin Str. MD-2004, MD-2012 Chisi:-au, Moldova Chisinau, Moldova Tel: + (373 22) 26 73 37 Tel: + (373 22) 200706 Fax: -- (373 22) 26 73 30 Fax: + (373 22) 200706
ï»¿E-ma.: andrei.darie@igov.se E-mail: Agobjilakworldbank.ori This Administration Agreement is drawn up in two originals, one for each party. It may t, amended only by written agreement of the parties hereto. SWEDEN, REPRESENTED BY Sida By: Name: H.E. Ingrid Tersman Title: Ambassador of the Kingdom of Sweden to Moldova Date: La INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENT/INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION By:___AAA-_ Name: Abdoulaye Seck Title: Country Manager, World B ank Office in Moldova Date: -- / o / 2-o I 2..
ï»¿ANNEX I Description of Activities and Expenditures under the Trust Fund This Annex shall be appliable to and form an integral part of the agreement entered into bntween the Bank and the Eono, that provides contributions to be administered by the Bank f >r the Trust Fund. A. DESCRIPTION OF ACTIVITIES The objective of this Trust Fu-d is to enhance the competitiveness of the Recipient's agro-food sector through: (i) supporting the modernization of the food safety management system; and (ii) facilitating marke access for farmers. Part A. Enhancing Food Safety Management (SEK2,974,500) Provision of goods, works, and consultants' services, including training for: (a) the provision of regtlatory and institutional support to the Ministry of Agriculture and -ood Industry (MAFI) for enhancing the food safety management systei through, inter alia: (i) supporting he process of legislative harmonization of the national legislation A ith the relevant EU regulations; and (ii) strengthening the institutional capacity of MAFI and its subordinated food safety management institutions through, inter alia: (a) staff training; and (b support for increasing awareness of relevant private entities regarding the application of the new food safety legislation. (b) Providing technical en[iancements support to MAFI for the food safety management througi: (i) strengthening of the animal and plant health and food safety laboratory network by providing equipment for two (2) central reference laboratories for: (A) animal health and food safety for products of animal origin, and (B) food safety for products of vegetable origin. Part B: Enhancing Market Access Potential (SEK14,872,500) Provision of goods, works, and consuL.ants' services, including training to MAFI for: (a) the provision of business development support to primary horticultural producers to establ.sh productive partnerships through, inter alia: (i) designing aid carrying out a public information and promotion campaign; ar d (ii) identifying, estatlishing and providing training to emerging productive partnerships.
ï»¿(b) the provision of support for investments on emerging productive partnerships to modernize post-harvest technologies in the horticultural sector. Part ' Project Management (SEK919,898) Prov ;on of goods, consultants' servLces, including audit and training, and operational costs for :utrposes of Project management and implementation, including monitoring and eval xion. B. CATEGORIES OF EXPENDITURES a) Goods b) Works c) Non-consulting services d) Consultants' services ei Operating costs f Training The foregoing categories of expenditures may include the financing of taxes.
